Name: OCT East
Address: 1001 Heping Mountain Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: A massive entertainment complex featuring multiple theme parks, shopping, dining, and nightlife. It's perfect for experiencing Shenzhen's modern vibrancy, with attractions ranging from thrilling rides to cultural performances.

Name: Shenzhen Bay Park
Address: Along Binhai Avenue, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: A scenic coastal park offering beautiful sea views, cycling and walking paths, and stunning night views of Hong Kong's skyline across the bay. It's a great spot for relaxation and photography.

Name: Window of the World
Address: An impressive theme park that showcases meticulously crafted miniature replicas of famous global landmarks, allowing visitors to explore world cultures in one place.
Short description: An impressive theme park that showcases meticulously crafted miniature replicas of famous global landmarks, allowing visitors to explore world cultures in one place.

Name: OCT Loft Creative Culture Park
Address: 2001 Heping Mountain Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: A former industrial area transformed into a vibrant arts district, featuring street art, unique shops, vintage stores, and creative cafés. It's ideal for strolling and experiencing Shenzhen's contemporary culture.

Name: Dameisha Seaside Park
Short description: Often considered the best beach in the region, offering long sandy beaches, clear waters, and various activities like swimming, water sports, sunbathing, and beach volleyball.

Name: Lianhua Hill Park
Short description: Located in the heart of Futian's CBD, this hill park offers a peaceful retreat with walking trails. The summit provides the best panoramic view of the city, especially breathtaking at night.

Name: Dapeng Fortress
Short description: A well-preserved Ming and Qing Dynasty coastal fortress with over 600 years of history. Visitors can explore ancient stone city gates, traditional dwellings, and the stately residences of former garrisons.

Name: Ping An Finance Centre
Address: 5055 Ping An Finance Centre, 5001, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: The city's tallest skyscraper offers breathtaking panoramic views from its observation deck, especially at night when the city lights up.

Name: Splendid China - Folk Culture Villages
Metro station: Window of the World Station (Metro Line 1 )
Address: 1001 East Hub Road, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Comprehensive cultural park displaying miniature Chinese landmarks and traditional ethnic minority villages. Hosts colorful daily dance and history shows.

Name: Dafen Oil Painting Village
Short description: Unique village originally famous for mass-producing oil painting replicas. Now a creative hub with art studios, galleries, and workshops.

Name: Nanshan Park
Address: No. 8, Bieshu Road, Liwan Community, Nanshan Street, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Mountain park with forested trails and panoramic views of Shenzhen.

Name: Shenzhen Museum of History & Folk Culture
Address: No. 6 Tongxin Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Government museum displaying exhibits on Shenzhen history and folk culture.

Name: Shenzhen Central Park
Address: 1 Zhenhua West Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Urban park with walking paths, sports fields, and a lake in central Shenzhen.

Name: Dongmen Pedestrian Street
Address: Intersection of Shennan East Road and Dongmen South Road, Luohu District, Shenzhen
Short description: Popular shopping street with shops, restaurants and street food vendors in an old city area.

Name: Huaqiangbei Electronics Market
Address: Huaqiang North Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Major electronics market district with multiple shopping malls and stalls selling gadgets and components.

Name: COCO Park (Futian)
Address: No. 23 Tairan Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Large shopping mall and nightlife complex with restaurants, bars, and entertainment near the convention center.

Name: Sea World
Address: 1128 Wanghai Road, Shekou, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Entertainment area around a docked ship with restaurants, bars, and shops in Shekou.

Name: Nantou Ancient Town
Address: 2 Nantou Jiaochang, Shennan Boulevard, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Historic town from the Ming and Qing eras with old temples, street markets and city wall remains.

Name: Meridian View Center
Address: 69F, Diwang Building, Bao’an South Road, Luohu District, Shenzhen
Short description: Observation deck on the 69th floor of a skyscraper with panoramic views of Shenzhen and Hong Kong.

Name: Fairy Lake Botanical Garden
Address: 160 Xianhu Road, Liantang, Luohu District, Shenzhen
Short description: Large botanical garden with diverse plant collections and a Taoist temple at its summit.

Name: Xiaomeisha Beach
Address: Xiaomeisha Seaside Resort, Yantian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Scenic sandy beach with clear water, popular for swimming and sunbathing.

Name: Shenzhen Safari Park
Address: 4065 Xili Lake Road, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Large wildlife park with animals such as tigers, pandas and elephants, plus animal shows.

Name: Happy Valley
Metro station: Window of the World Station, Line 1
Address: Qiaocheng West Road, Overseas Chinese Town, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Major amusement park with roller coasters and themed entertainment areas for families.

Name: Waterlands Resort
Address: West Waterlands Resort Tourism Area, Shajing, Bao'an District, Shenzhen
Short description: Rural eco-park with gardens and water features offering outdoor activities and relaxation.

Name: Yantian Fishermen's New Village
Short description: Seaside village known for its blue waters and coastal scenery.

Name: Xiaomeisha Sea World
Address: Xiaomeisha Seaside Resort, Yantian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Marine park and aquarium with sea life exhibits and dolphin shows.

Name: He Xiangning Art Museum
Metro station: Window of the World Station, Line 1
Address: No. 9013 Shennan Boulevard, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Museum dedicated to modern Chinese art, named after painter and politician He Xiangning.

Name: Sea World Culture & Arts Center
Address: No. 1187 Wanghai Road, Shekou, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Cultural complex with theaters and galleries hosting art exhibitions and performances.

Name: Luohu Commercial City
Short description: Large market and mall complex at the Hong Kong border, offering clothing, accessories and souvenirs.

Name: Shenzhen Museum of Art & Urban Planning
Address: No. 6 Tongxin Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Exhibition space focusing on Shenzhen's urban development, architecture and contemporary art.

Name: Shenzhen Book City
Short description: Huge multi-level bookstore with extensive Chinese and English collections.

Name: Xiwan Mangrove Park
Address: Intersection of Jinwan Avenue and West Seawall, Bao'an District, Shenzhen
Short description: Coastal park with mangrove forests and cycling paths in west Shenzhen Bay.

Name: Longgang COCO Park
Address: Intersection of Shenhui Road and Huangge South Road, Longgang District, Shenzhen
Short description: Large shopping and entertainment mall in Longgang's CBD with cinemas and restaurants.

Name: Shenzhen Universiade Sports Centre
Short description: Major sports complex including a stadium and arena built for the 2011 Universiade.

Name: Bijiashan Park
Address: No. 26 Meigang Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Urban hill park with forested paths and several viewpoints overlooking Futian CBD and nearby districts.

Name: Xiangmi Park
Short description: Beautifully landscaped park featuring a rose garden and elevated walking paths. Popular for wedding photography and relaxing strolls.

Name: Wutong Mountain
Address: 2076 Luosha Road, Liantang, Luohu District, Shenzhen
Short description: Tallest peak in Shenzhen with forest trails and scenic views of the city and coastline.

Name: Coastal City Mall
Address: No. 33 Wenxin Road, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Upscale mall in Shekou with a variety of shops, restaurants and a multiplex cinema.

Name: Luohu Immigration Checkpoint
Short description: Historic border checkpoint connecting Shenzhen and Hong Kong, notable for its distinctive architecture.

Name: Futian Immigration Checkpoint
Address: Futian Checkpoint Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Major land crossing between Shenzhen and Hong Kong near the city center.

Name: Bao'an Olympic Sports Center
Short description: Large sports complex used for regional athletic events and concerts.

Name: Xianhu Park
Short description: Scenic lakeside park known for its lotus-themed gardens and pavilions.

Name: SEG Electronics Market
Address: Huaqiang North Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Multi-story mall with stalls selling electronic components, computers and audio equipment.

Name: SKP Shenzhen
Address: 313 Shennan East Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Luxury shopping mall with international designer brands and upscale amenities.

Name: Civic Center (Grand Square)
Short description: Open plaza in front of the Futian Civic Center with a fountain and the May Fourth Memorial.

Name: Honghu Park
Short description: Public park with a lotus pond and walking paths in urban Luohu.

Name: Guantian Mountain Park
Short description: Hilly park with trails leading to summit views of the city.

Name: Fenhu Ocean World
Address: No. 169 Xiwan Road, Bao'an District, Shenzhen
Short description: Aquarium on Fenhu Lake featuring marine life exhibits and dolphin performances.

Name: Donghu Park
Short description: Lakeside urban park with walking paths and green spaces in Futian.

Name: Tianhou Palace
Short description: Historic temple complex by the sea dedicated to the goddess Mazu.

Name: Dangan Ancient City
Short description: Ruins of an ancient walled city dating to the 14th century, with temples and streets.

Name: KK Mall
Address: Intersection of Guangming Road and Jintian Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: High-end mall with fashion boutiques and a cinema in the Futian business district.

Name: Gushu Park
Short description: City park known for its large ancient banyan tree and landscaped gardens.

Name: Taizi Mountain Park
Short description: Hiking park featuring trails and temples on Taizi (Prince) Mountain.

Name: Bao'an Cultural Center
Short description: Large performing arts venue with unique architecture hosting concerts and shows.

Name: MixC Shenzhen
Address: No. 1881 Shennan Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: Luxury shopping mall with international brands, art installations, and a cinema.

Name: Bao'an Museum
Short description: Local museum presenting the history and heritage of Bao'an District.

Name: Shenzhen Science & Technology Museum
Short description: Interactive science museum with exhibits on technology and innovation.

Name: K11 Ecoast
Address: No. 83 Qianhai Road, Nanshan District, Shenzhen
Short description: Seaside complex with retail and cultural spaces, including art exhibits and waterfront views.

Name: Reform and Opening-up Museum
Short description: Exhibition hall showcasing Shenzhen’s development since 1978.

Name: Nantou Ancient City
Short description: Historic walled city dating back to the Jin Dynasty with renovated alleyways and museums. Features trendy cafes, craft shops, and historical exhibits.

Name: Shenzhen Talent Park
Short description: Scenic urban park surrounded by skyscrapers with a beautiful lake and light shows. Ideal for night photography of the modern Nanshan skyline.

Name: OCT-LOFT Creative Culture Park
Short description: Former industrial zone transformed into a trendy art district with galleries and coffee shops. Hosts regular creative markets and live music events.

Name: Dutch Flower World
Short description: European-style garden center with windmills, tulips, and flower shops. A picturesque spot for leisurely walks and buying plants.

Name: Chiwan Tin Hau Temple
Short description: Important historical temple dedicated to the Goddess of the Sea with traditional architecture. A quiet spiritual site reflecting Shenzhen's maritime history.

Name: Evergreen Resort
Short description: Eco-park blending agriculture with tourism featuring rainforests and flower gardens. Great for families interested in nature and eco-friendly activities.

Name: Shenzhen Civic Center
Short description: Massive government building with a distinct roof resembling a bird's wings. Houses the Shenzhen Museum and offers a great backdrop for photos.

Name: Shenzhen Museum
Short description: Comprehensive museum showcasing the history of Shenzhen from ancient times to modern reform. Features realistic dioramas and historical artifacts.

Name: Ping An Finance Center
Short description: Shenzhen's tallest building featuring the Free Sky observation deck on the 116th floor. Offers 360-degree views of the city and Hong Kong.

Name: Coco Park
Short description: Popular modern mall known for its open-air courtyard and vibrant bar street. A top destination for dining and nightlife in the city center.

Name: Shenzhen Concert Hall
Short description: Architectural gem hosting classical music concerts and cultural performances. Features a stunning glass facade that lights up beautifully at night.

Name: Shuiwei 1368 Cultural Block
Short description: Vibrant pedestrian area packed with colorful bars, cafes, and street food stalls. Combines traditional village layout with modern nightlife vibes.

Name: Futian Mangrove Ecological Park
Short description: Protected wetland area offering bird watching and views of the Shenzhen Bay ecosystem. A serene nature spot strictly managed for conservation.

Name: Garden Expo Park
Short description: Huge park showcasing diverse garden styles from around China and the world. Features pagodas, pavilions, and botanical exhibits.

Name: UpperHills
Short description: Trendy complex connecting two parks with colorful loft-style architecture. Famous for its photogenic bridges and high-end lifestyle shops.

Name: Diwang Mansion
Short description: Iconic green skyscraper that was once the tallest in Asia. Features an observation deck with exhibits on the city's skyline history.

Name: KK100
Short description: Sleek supertall skyscraper housing the St. Regis hotel with high tea and bar options. Offers luxury dining with spectacular high-altitude views.

Name: People's Park
Short description: Historical park known for its extensive rose garden and tranquil lake. A favorite spot for locals practicing tai chi and dancing.

Name: The MixC Luohu
Short description: Premier luxury shopping mall hosting high-end international brands. Features an Olympic-standard ice skating rink and gourmet dining.

Name: Hongfa Temple
Short description: Most famous Buddhist temple in Shenzhen, located scenically on a hillside. Bustling with worshippers and offers vegetarian food.

Name: Yantian Seaside Plank Road
Short description: Wooden boardwalk stretching kilometers along the rocky coastline. Offers stunning ocean views and is perfect for a long sunset walk.

Name: Enshang Wetland Park
Short description: High-altitude wetland park offering fresh air and views of the harbor. A quiet retreat for hiking and picnicking away from crowds.

Name: Yantian Seafood Street
Short description: Famous waterfront street lined with restaurants serving fresh local seafood. Diners can pick their own live seafood from tanks.

Name: One Mall
Short description: Large shopping complex located right by the seaside promenade. Features a distinctive architectural design and diverse dining options.

Name: Dafen Oil Painting Village
Short description: Unique village originally famous for mass-producing oil painting replicas. Now a creative hub with art studios, galleries, and workshops.

Name: Gankeng Ancient Town
Short description: Restored Hakka walled village featuring ancient architecture and narrow lanes. Beautifully lit at night with traditional lanterns and cultural displays.

Name: Universiade Sports Center
Short description: Futuristic crystal-shaped stadium complex built for the 2011 Universiade. A landmark for architecture lovers and venue for major events.

Name: Longgang Cultural Centre
Short description: Distinctive red geometric buildings housing a science museum and art gallery. Features striking modern architecture by Mecanoo.

Name: Crane Lake Hakka Village
Short description: One of the largest preserved Hakka enclosed compounds in China. Houses the Museum of Hakka Culture with informative exhibits.

Name: Shenzhen Red Cube
Short description: Three iconic red buildings housing a science museum, youth palace, and public art museum. Interactive exhibits make it great for educational visits.

Name: OH Bay
Short description: Modern waterfront park featuring the massive Bay Glory ferris wheel. Offers an exciting mix of retail, dining, and scenic green spaces.

Name: Phoenix Mountain Forest Park
Short description: Significant religious site with temples nestled in a lush mountain forest. Popular for hiking and wishing at the Phoenix Temple.

Name: Uniwalk
Short description: One of Shenzhen's largest malls with sleek design and huge variety of stores. Known for its impressive interior and extensive food court.

Name: F518 Idea Land
Short description: Creative industrial park hosting design studios and quirky art installations. A quiet spot to see Shenzhen's design scene in action.

Name: Shenzhen University
Short description: European-style garden center with windmills, tulips, and flower shops. A picturesque spot for leisurely walks and buying plants.

Name: Lizhi Park
Short description: Long strip of greenery offering a quiet escape with streams and tropical plants. Ideal for jogging and escaping the urban bustle.

Name: Convention and Exhibition Center
Short description: Architectural gem hosting classical music concerts and cultural performances. Features a stunning glass facade that lights up beautifully at night.

Name: Kingkey 100
Address: 5016 Shennan East Road, Luohu District, Shenzhen
Short description: Iconic green skyscraper that was once the tallest in Asia. Features an observation deck with exhibits on the city's skyline history.

Name: Dameisha Beach
Short description: Popular public beach park with distinctive winged sculptures and swimming areas. Great for coastal walks and enjoying the sea breeze.

Name: Zhongying Street
Short description: Vibrant pedestrian area packed with colorful bars, cafes, and street food stalls. Combines traditional village layout with modern nightlife vibes.

Name: Yangtai Mountain
Short description: High-altitude wetland park offering fresh air and views of the harbor. A quiet retreat for hiking and picnicking away from crowds.

Name: Shiyan Lake Hot Spring Resort
Short description: Important historical temple dedicated to the Goddess of the Sea with traditional architecture. A quiet spiritual site reflecting Shenzhen's maritime history.

Name: Museum of Contemporary Art & Planning Exhibition
Short description: Distinctive red geometric buildings housing a science museum and art gallery. Features striking modern architecture by Mecanoo.

Name: Jin Guanghua Plaza
Address: Renmin South Road, Luohu District, Shenzhen
Short description: Large shopping complex located right by the seaside promenade. Features a distinctive architectural design and diverse dining options.

Name: The MixC
Address: Baoan South Road, Luohu District, Shenzhen
Short description: Premier luxury shopping mall hosting high-end international brands. Features an Olympic-standard ice skating rink and gourmet dining.

Name: Maoye Mall
Address: Huaqiang North Road, Futian District, Shenzhen
Short description: One of Shenzhen's largest malls with sleek design and huge variety of stores. Known for its impressive interior and extensive food court.

Name: Design Society
Short description: Creative industrial park hosting design studios and quirky art installations. A quiet spot to see Shenzhen's design scene in action.

Name: Longcheng Park
Short description: Large comprehensive park with a reservoir, amusement rides, and art gallery. Hosts the annual chrysanthemum exhibition in autumn.

Name: Shatoujiao
Short description: A border town with historical significance. It reflects colonial history.

Name: Yantian Port
Short description: A major port with views of shipping operations. It is one of China's busiest ports.
